items

Class ItemSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • items.ItemSet

  • public class ItemSet
extends java.lang.Object
    ItemSet is a combination of a weapon, a shield, and boots as defined in Item. An ItemSet is provided to the MainCharacter because it removes the necessity for direct interaction with the items.

    Changes: The class now supports all interactions between MainCharacter and ItemInventory.

    Total Time Spent: 3 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] charsAvail
      All the characters provided by the combination of the Items.
      private Item[] items
      The two Items: a weapon and a shield.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ItemSet()
      Creates an empty set of Items, following the two character rule of an ItemSet.

    • Field Detail

      • items

        private Item[] items
        The two Items: a weapon and a shield.

      • charsAvail

        private int[] charsAvail
        All the characters provided by the combination of the Items. Availability of characters is defined in Item.charsAvail. An ItemSet always provides 2 of each character.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemSet

        public ItemSet()
        Creates an empty set of Items, following the two character rule of an ItemSet.

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public int[] getCharsAvail()

      • getCharAvail

        public int getCharAvail(int pos)
        Gets the amount of the char available at pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - position of the char being searched for.
        Returns:
        The amount of the character linked with pos available.

      • getCharAvail

        public int getCharAvail(char which)
        Gets the amount of the char which available.
        Parameters:
        which - the char being searched for
        Returns:
        The amount of the which char.
